content.description: Climb easy rock up and right to the first bolt (long sling). Big moves with big holds lead to a tricky move around the corner right. Work up to and through the crux at bolt 4, then up easier moves to the ledge with anchors.
content.location: Start about 30 feet up from the road at a broken ledge system. The line takes the faint prow to the right.

content.description: This climb is listed as 5.10d in the guidebook, but it is a bit of a sandbag at the grade. Follow good holds past 4 bolts along a steep arete. Join the 5.11d to the right at the last bolt.
content.location: Start off the left side of the large boulder at the base.

content.description: A decent warm-up climb in The Trough.  Follow good holds up the face, trending right toward the shallow, left-trending arete/ramp system.  There's no specific crux, though route-finding is a little funny; follow the path of least resistance, rather than trying to contrive a line straight through the bolts.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2-bolt anchor with a couple 'biners; bring some webbing if you're so inclined.
content.location:
Life is the 6th line of bolts up the trough,

Hyssop

being the first - probably ~75 feet up from the road.

content.description: Start at broken but solid rock with big holds on the lower right side of the wall. Carefully climb up to the first bolt. Reach up right for a rail of holds and traverse left to the third bolt. Power up (crux) to a good hold, then up over a bulge. Follow the quartz groove up and left to the anchors. This route diagonals up and left, and hence is somewhat difficult to clean.
content.location: Start about 15 feet from the road on a fractured face with big holds. It is probably a good idea to keep your gear as far from the road as possible so that no drivers are startled.

content.description: This nice face climb is just right of the obvious crack feature. Crimp edges down low lead to a slightly overhung face that is higher quality than one might expect.
content.location:
This is to the left of

Life In The Trough

.

content.description:
This route has three or four star climbing on on one star rock.

Start in the gully next to a large boulder. Follow bolts up past an undercling/lieback feature, then figure out how to turn the roof as the pump builds. Finish up past the last bolt to anchors shared with Black Crocus.
content.location: It is next to a big boulder about 50 feet up the gully.

content.description: Work up very easy rock in the corner to the first bolt, then blast up the overhanging wall, passing two breaks, to a finish that is much easier but still a bit dirty. Keep moving straight up until you can step left to the chains. Near the end of the overhanging section, you will use a large hold on the right that looks iffy but appears to be pretty solid. Endurance crux.
content.location:
Start just a few paces to the left of

Wild Rose

below a corner that leads right up to the black streak.
